Welcome_to_Portainer: Welcome to Portainer ! Click on any endpoint in the list below to access management features.
You_do_not_have_access_to_any_environmen: You do not have access to any environment. Please contact your administrator.

Portainer_has_full_support_for_Docker: Portainer has full support for Docker >=1.10 and partial support for Docker 1.9 (some features may not be available).
at_least_8_characters_long: Your new password must be at least 8 characters long
cannot_change_pwd_when_using_LDAP: You cannot change your password when using LDAP authentication.
Name: Name
The_Docker_API_must_be_exposed_over_TCP: The Docker API must be exposed over TCP. You can find more information about how to expose the Docker API over TCP
Ensure_that_you_have_deployed_the_Portai: Ensure that you have deployed the Portainer agent in your cluster first. You can use execute the following command on any manager node to deploy it.
URL_or_IP_address_of_a_Docker_host_must_: URL or IP address of a Docker host. The Docker API must be exposed over a TCP port. Please refer to the Docker documentation to configure it.
URL_or_IP_address_where_exposed_containe: URL or IP address where exposed containers will be reachable. This field is optional and will default to the endpoint URL.
Endpoint_management_via_the_UI_is_disabl: Endpoint management via the UI is disabled.
You_can_still_manage_endpoint_access: You can still manage endpoint access.
Please_create_the_initial_administrator_: Please create the initial administrator user.
Connect_Portainer_to_the_Docker_environm: Connect Portainer to the Docker environment you want to manage.
Manage_the_Docker_environment_where_Port: Manage the Docker environment where Portainer is running.
Ensure_started_the_Portainer_container: Ensure that you have started the Portainer container with the following Docker flag:
Connectdirectly_Portainer_agent_running_: Connect directly to a Portainer agent running inside a Swarm cluster.
URLFORMAT: If you have started Portainer in the same overlay network as the agent, you can use tasks.AGENT_SERVICE_NAME:AGENT_SERVICE_PORT as the endpoint URL format.
Connect Portainer to a remote Docker environment using the Docker API over TCP.
URLorIPaddressofaDockerhostwithAPIexpose: URL or IP address of a Docker host with API exposed over TCP.
Enable_this_option_if_you_needto_specify: Enable this option if you need to specify TLS certificates to connect to the Docker endpoint.
Enable_this_option_if_you_need_to_authen: Enable this option if you need to authenticate server based on given CA.
Enable this option if you need to authenticate with a client certificate.
You_can_select_which_user_or_team_can_ac: You can select which user or team can access this registry by moving them to the authorized accesses table. Simply click on a user or team entry to move it from one table to the other.
Docker_requires_you_to_connect_to_a: Docker requires you to connect to a
You_can_find_more_about_secure_registry: You can find more information about how to connect to an insecure registry
URL_or_IP_address_of_a_Docker_registry_A: URL or IP address of a Docker registry. Any protocol will be stripped.
Enable_this_option_if_you_need_to_specif: Enable this option if you need to specify credentials to connect to this registry.
URL_or_IP_address_of_a_Docker_registry: URL or IP address of a Docker registry.
Enable_this_option_if_you_specify_creden: Enable this option if you need to specify credentials to connect to this registry.
The_DockerHub_registry_can_be_used_by_an: The DockerHub registry can be used by any user. You can specify the credentials that will be used to push & pull images here.
Enable_this_option_if_you_need_to_specif: Enable this option if you need to specify credentials to connect to push/pull private images.
Tasks_are_retrieved_across_all_endpoints: Tasks are retrieved across all endpoints via snapshots. Data available in this view might not be up-to-date.
When_using_internal_authentication_Porta: When using internal authentication, Portainer will encrypt user passwords and store credentials locally.
When_using_LDAP_authentication_Portainer: When using LDAP authentication, Portainer will delegate user authentication to a LDAP server and fallback to internal authentication if LDAP authentication fails.
URL_or_IP_address_of_the_LDAP_server: URL or IP address of the LDAP server.
Account_that_will_be_used_to_search_for_: Account that will be used to search for users.
Enable_this_option_if_want_to_use_StartT: Enable this option if want to use StartTLS to secure the connection to the server. Ignored if Use TLS is selected.
Enable this option if you need to specify TLS certificates to connect to the LDAP server.
Skip_the_verification_of_the_server_TLS_: Skip the verification of the server TLS certificate. Not recommended on unsecured networks.
With_automatic_user_provisioning_enabled: With automatic user provisioning enabled, Portainer will create user(s) automatically with standard user role and assign them to team(s) which matches to LDAP group name(s). If disabled, users must be created in Portainer beforehand.
The_distinguished_name_of_the_element_fr: The distinguished name of the element from which the LDAP server will search for users.
LDAP_attribute_which_denotes_the_usernam: LDAP attribute which denotes the username.
LDAP_search_filter_used_to_select_user_e: The LDAP search filter used to select user elements, optional.
The_distinguished_name_of_the_element_fr: The distinguished name of the element from which the LDAP server will search for groups.
LDAP_attribute_which_denotes_the_group_m: LDAP attribute which denotes the group membership.
LDAP_search_filter_select_group_elements: The LDAP search filter used to select group elements, optional.
specify_URL_logo_For_an_optimal_display_: You can specify the URL to your logo here. For an optimal display, logo dimensions should be 155px by 55px.
externaltemplates: When using external templates, in-app template management will be disabled.
specify_the_URL_to_your_own_template_def: You can specify the URL to your own template definitions file here.
When_enabled_regular_users_will_not_be_a: When enabled, regular users will not be able to use bind mounts when creating containers.
When_enabled_regular_users_privileged_mo: When enabled, regular users will not be able to use privileged mode when creating containers.
You_can_hide_containers_with_specific_la: You can hide containers with specific labels from Portainer UI. You need to specify the label name and value.

use_URL_git_repository: You can use the URL of a git repository.

stack_created_outside_Portainer_Control_: This stack was created outside of Portainer. Control over this stack is limited.

Administrators_access_settings_full_cont: Administrators have access to Portainer settings management as well as full control over all defined endpoints and their resources.

have_not_created_team: You have not yet created any team.

When enabled, you can restrict the access and management of this resource.
restrict _management_resource_to_adminis: I want to restrict the management of this resource to administrators only
restrict_management_resource_users_teams: I want to restrict the management of this resource to a set of users and/or teams
resource_manageable_by_myself_only: I want to this resource to be manageable by myself only
want_member_of_team: I want any member of my team
able_to_manage_resource: to be able to manage this resource

as_a_member_select_teams_manage_this_res: As you are a member of multiple teams, you can select which teams(s) will be able to manage this resource.

resource_managed_by_restricted_users_and: This resource can be managed by a restricted set of users and/or teams.
Access_control_on_resource_inherited_fol: Access control on this resource is inherited from the following service
Access_control_applied_on_service_applie: Access control applied on a service is also applied on each container of that service.

Access_control_applied_container: Access control applied on a container created using a template is also applied on each volume associated to the container.

template_only_available_administrator_us: Should this template be only available to administrator users.
The_command_to_run_in_the_container: The command to run in the container. If not specified, the container will use the default command specified in its Dockerfile.
Set_the_hostname_of_the_container: Set the hostname of the container. Will use Docker default if not specified.
Portainer_will_automatically_assign_a_po: Portainer will automatically assign a port if you leave the host port empty.

Portainer_will_let_Docker_sth: When enabled, Portainer will let Docker automatically map a random port on the host to each one defined in the image Dockerfile.

list_of_the_running_processes_inside: as well as a list of the running processes  inside this container.

specify_multiple_names: You can specify multiple names to your image.

Upload_tarball_or_a_Dockerfile: Upload a tarball or a Dockerfile from your computer
Specify_an_URL_to_a_file: Specify an URL to a file
upload_Dockerfile_or_a_tar: You can upload a Dockerfile or a tar archive containing a Dockerfile from your computer. When using an tarball, the root folder will be used as the build context.
Indicate the path to the Dockerfile within the tarball.
Specify_Dockerfile_tarball_public_Git: Specify the URL to a Dockerfile, a tarball or a public Git repository (suffixed by .git). When using a tarball or a Git repository URL, the root folder will be used as the build context.
Indicate_Dockerfile_erfile: Indicate the path to the Dockerfile within the tarball/repository (ignored when using a Dockerfile).
upload_archive_containing_your_images: You can upload a tar archive containing your images.
Note_if_you_dont_specify_the_tag: Note: if you don't specify the tag in the image name,
Restrict_external_access_to_the_network: Restrict external access to the network
Secrets_base64_encoded: Secrets need to be base64 encoded. Disable this if your secret is already base64 encoded.
Minimum_memory_available_on: Minimum memory available on a node to run a task
Minimum_CPU_available_on: Minimum CPU available on a node to run a task
secrets_available_under: By default, secrets will be available under
Maximum_number_of_tasks_updated_simultan: Maximum number of tasks to be updated simultaneously (0 to update all at once).
Amount_of_time_between_updates: Amount of time between updates expressed by a number followed by unit (ns|us|ms|s|m|h). Default value is 0s, 0 seconds.
Action_taken_on_failure: Action taken on failure to start after update.
Restart_condition_is_met: Restart when condition is met (default condition 'any').
Delay_between_restart_attempts_expressed: Delay between restart attempts expressed by a number followed by unit (ns|us|ms|s|m|h). Default value is 5s, 5 seconds.
Maximum_attempts_restart_given: Maximum attempts to restart a given task before giving up (default value is 0, which means unlimited).
Time_window_to_evaluate_restart: Time window to evaluate restart attempts expressed by a number followed by unit (ns|us|ms|s|m|h). Default value is 0 seconds, which is unbounded.
Logging_driver_for_service_that_will: Logging driver for service that will override the default docker daemon driver. Select Default logging driver if you don't want to override it. Supported logging drivers can be found
